author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In celestial forge where base metals dwell,
With golden promise did the markets swell,
The fiscal realm beset, a clouded sky,
From Western debt and Eastern dreams awry.

Siemens, stalwart in a treacherous tide,
Profit and fortune at its verséd side,
By orders fell and revenue's sweet grace,
A shadow vanquished 'gainst stern Healthineers' face.

Forsooth, their tales of yore uncovered truth:
In harvest's second phase, results uncouth,
A steady beacon, shining industrial glow,
Shalt elevate them hence, 'midst fortune's ebb and flow.

feedItems.title: Base Metals Recover After US Debt Worries, Sluggish China Demand Hit Prices
feedItems.description: Base metals were higher, with gold flat, in early London trade, as worries over the U.S. debt ceiling and Chinese demand continued to drag on markets.

feedItems.title: Siemens's 2Q Orders, Revenue Growth Offset Healthineers Weakness
feedItems.description: Siemens orders and revenue in the second quarter increased and exceeded consensus estimates, Bernstein said, and thinks investors should react positively to the results.

feedItems.title: Siemens Outperforms in Second Quarter, Lifts Outlook
feedItems.description: Siemens posted an above-forecast net result in the second quarter, as profits at its industrial businesses hit a record €2.6 billion, and upgraded its guidance for the year.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of carriages with lightning's speed, in April's heart amass,
The skies do sing in praise, on Valfather's pass,
Upon the iron steeds they tread, electric gales do blow,
A rise in sales, in Odin's realm, one-seventh span they grow.

From German land, a tale unrolls, that gallant year and place,
The Herculean Bund, in February's race,
Uncertain worth, in golden halls, Citi's seers proclaim,
As auction's grip doth clasp the fate, a spark within the flame.

A mighty rise, the dollar stands, in eked-out force and grace,
For Thor's great hammer weighs upon the Chinese wreath—a trace,
In fear and worry, Fárbauti's child doth clench the yuan with haste,
While Baldur shines on western shore, improved data's taste.

feedItems.title: EU New Car Sales Lifted by EV Demand
feedItems.description: EU car registrations rose 17% year-on-year in April, with sales of fully electric cars up 52%.

feedItems.title: Limited Relative Value Seen in Germany's February 2033 Bund Pre-Auction
feedItems.description: Germany’s 2.30% February 2033 Bund, which will be reopened at an auction later on Wednesday, offers limited relative value, according to Citi.

feedItems.title: Dollar Rises on China Slowdown Fears, Improved US Data
feedItems.description: The dollar hit a five-week high against a basket of currencies due to concerns about a slowing Chinese economy, which is weighing heavily on Asian and Latin American currencies, MUFG said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of shares, Chinese folk did seek to vend,
In Swiss lands far, their stocks entwined,
But profits fell, and trading, thin as air,
A mead less sweet, hath greet their venture fair.

Munich Re in April morn did see,
A profit flush, enriched by renewals free,
Their purse now swells an '23 gain,
EUR4 billion worth, 'neath company mane.

Aegon, confident in strategy and sight,
With capital strong in spring's fair light,
A five percent leap in fortunes hath wrought,
Their cup runneth full with free-flowing thought.

feedItems.title: Chinese Companies Looked to Switzerland to Sell Shares---Things Haven't Been Great
feedItems.description: An expanded stock link between exchanges in China and Europe has helped companies raise money, but trading is anemic and prices have fallen.

feedItems.title: Munich Re Upbeat on Full Year After Renewals Boost
feedItems.description: Munich Re posted an above-forecast net profit in the first quarter and said it still expected a net result of about EUR4 billion for the 2023 but that profitable growth confirmed by its reinsurance renewals as of April 1 mean the chances of surpassing that target have increased.

feedItems.title: Aegon Confident on Strategy and Outlook
feedItems.description: Aegon reported a 5% rise in operating capital generation for the first quarter of 2023 and said it was confident of delivering on its financial guidance for the year.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In chambers where UBS doth dwell,
From Credit Suisse, a tale they tell,
Four billion legal burdens weigh,
Their balance sheet, it dost display.

Commerzbank profits rise anew,
Their outlook gleams, as fortunes brew,
In quarter first, their core attained,
By higher rates, the gain sustained.

To Hiroshima, Fumio goes,
With Biden's ear, his plea he shows,
To rid the world of weapons dire,
A nuclear-free life, he aspires.

feedItems.title: UBS Plans for $4 Billion Legal Hit From Credit Suisse Deal
feedItems.description: The Swiss bank released new details about the acquisition’s likely impact on its balance sheet.

feedItems.title: Commerzbank Outlook on Track as Profits Jump
feedItems.description: Commerzbank confirmed its guidance for the year after reporting higher-than-expected profit and core revenues for the first quarter, helped by higher interest rates.

feedItems.title: Haunted by Hiroshima, Japanese Leader to Meet Biden With a Push for No Nukes
feedItems.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has said ridding the world of nuclear weapons is his life’s work, but the task looks ever more difficult as he gathers world leaders in Hiroshima.
